text:
There's a solid chocolate Easter egg – here's where to get it An epic egg Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now This is a solid chocolate egg Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
The Easter bunny has changed her diet. She's also been hitting the gym. These days, she's laying solid chocolate eggs. 
That's right – eggs, chocolate eggs, which are completely solid. No shell, no hollow interior. Just pure, hard, Easter chocolate. The rabbit has also been laying cheese eggs, but anyway. 
The new chocolate eggs are made of 42 bite-size building blocks. They resemble a fun time-passing kids' puzzle you might find in a restaurant with colouring sheets and crayons. Solid (Photo: Solid Chocolate Company) Read More Footie fan's comments on Dublin drinks prices sparks huge backlash from Irish locals 
"Remember when you were a child and the excitement of being given an Easter egg?" says the Solid Chocolate Company, which is behind the creation. 
"Do you also remember the disappointment of opening all that packaging and breaking the egg only to find it was hollow?" 
The Solid Chocolate Company claims its product is a "world first". Each egg weights 750g, and forged from Belgian chocolate. Possibly the best option (Photo: Solid Chocolate Conapny) Read More This amazing alternative Easter egg could be even better than chocolate 
"It's not rocket science to just put two solid halves together, but that wasn't good enough for us," says the company. "We wanted to have an egg made of solid, bite-sized pieces that fit together to make a solid egg." 
The eggs come in milk, white, dark, or caramel chocolate. But be warned – there's a hefty pricetag. £24.99 to be exact. It's a novelty indeed. If you do feel like going all out, the eggs are available on Amazon, or here . Like us on Facebook
